column5: Did Kimberly's Eagle West Resort get purchased? Was looking at resorts on eagle and noticed that it had a new web site. Stayed there a few years ago and the guy who was running it, was wanting to sell because of his age, and none of his kids wanted to take over. Nice cabins but camp was starting to get run down. Any one know who is now running the camp, or what happened to the previous owner? Thanks, Dean
Yes, Steve Kimberly sold the camp this summer. I believe the new owner's name is Trevor.

Gord,Don't want to spread rumors, but you're the guy in the know. I understood an Eagle Lake fishing guide was gonna buy another camp up there. It was either North Shore Lodge or South Shore Lodge. Know anything about this? Thanks
That's news to me. Most fishing guides I know wouldn't have the $$ to consider such a move. Both those camps would be a big investment. I would consider it a rumour until proven otherwise.

i heard it from a buddy of mine from calgary (vbay gord knows who) and he told me that what is circulating in the west arm area is a fellow from the oil patch in Alberta has bought it and he was going to target his fellow oil patch workers as his cliental

We had an awesome time the last week of May. Dad got a pair of 32" walleyes on the portage lakes and Eagle produced as usual. Camp is looking good and the NEW equipment was a great. Looking forward to many more years on Eagle and enjoying eagle west resort. Thanks Trevor!
Geez Gord, it only took a year and a half, but I finally saw confirmation of what I was talking about - Scott Jaeger (guide at AML) bought North Shore Lodge.
I confirm... His brother Tony told me this a couple of weeks ago ....Great news Scott ... All the best in your NEW adventure ...You are a great guy and will be an awesome Lodge owner ..

Kwags, it's been a busy year and a half. Julian, formerly at North Shore Lodge, purchasing Andy Meyers, and Scott Jaeger, formerly at AML, purchasing North Shore Lodge. Like I said, it's a rumor until proven otherwise. Scott is a great guy, and I have many fond memories of working my early years at North Shore Lodge. Scott and NSL is a good combination, I wish him well.
I was really beginning to think I had a hearing problem.
